column4: ok - i just followed instruction under "Resolution is not delivered by the vBios" section... it doesn't work :|
this is a very stubborn problem
is anybody else willing to go thru with me step by step via PM?
can't get a higher screen res.?
- nope.... the only way i can get to desktop is using VESA
what video card do you have?
- I'm using Intel Graphic Media Accelerator 950 (HP DV1000t laptop)
what was the original driver xorg set?
- it picked i810
what happens when you used that one?
- the error says "failed to start x server (your graphical interface)" so i had to use VESA to get to desktop
*nod* i couldn'tuse the ati driver on this card, whereas fglrx works fine.  maybe pastebin /var/log/Xorg.0.log when it fails
either that or search the forum for your card/ the driver
- i did.. tried 915resolution... won't work the way i want
i'm not familiar w/ 915.  did you try reconfigging xorg w/ the i810 driver?
- how do i reconfigure i810 driver?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg ... go through the steps, press default if you don't know what to enter, but choose the i810 driver when prompted
- i picked i810 and that's what causing the error. failed to start x server
so you already ran the reconfig command?
- yup
i thought your problem was that you were forced to use vesa :-/
course it is.  vesa only provides software rendering iirc
you want ff1.5?
- yup
